actual_sources_scanned: WebSearch (TechCrunch, MIT Tech Review, Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum)
WebSearch (US Federal Register, WHO, OECD, UN News, EUR-Lex)
WebSearch (Brookings, WEF, Pew Research, Carbon Brief)
WebSearch (Google Patents, NASA Climate, BIS, IMF)

items.title: D-Wave Achieves Scalable On-Chip Cryogenic Control for Gate-Model Qubits

content.abstract: D-Wave demonstrates scalable on-chip cryogenic control for gate-model qubits, claiming a first-in-industry milestone that overcomes a long-standing obstacle to commercially viable quantum computers.

items.title: EeroQ Demonstrates Million-Qubit Control Architecture with Wonder Lake Chip

content.abstract: EeroQ showcases a control architecture capable of managing one million qubits using fewer than 50 control lines via its Wonder Lake chip, marking a significant breakthrough in quantum scalability.

items.title: EU Launches SUPREME Consortium: EUR 50M to Industrialize Superconducting Quantum Technology

content.abstract: The European Union launches the SUPREME consortium with EUR 50 million budget to bridge the 'lab-to-fab' gap for superconducting quantum technology, aiming to move quantum devices to higher technology readiness levels.

items.title: Global Trade Growth Subdued at 2.6% as Tariff Uncertainty Becomes Top Risk

content.abstract: UNCTAD reports global economic growth projected at 2.6% for 2026. Tariff policy changes become the most-cited risk to global growth, with semiconductors now tariffed based on Country of Design rather than Country of Origin.

items.title: China's Artificial Sun Breaks Plasma Density Limits Previously Thought Unbreakable

content.abstract: China's EAST tokamak pushes plasma density well past the Greenwald limit without triggering disruptive instabilities, breaking a decades-old empirical limit in fusion research and advancing the path to commercial fusion energy.

items.title: NEW START Treaty Expiration: Last Nuclear Arms Control Pact Between US and Russia Ends Feb 5

content.abstract: The New START treaty, the last remaining nuclear arms control agreement between the US and Russia, expired on February 5, 2026. The failure to extend creates an unprecedented situation where no verified limits exist on the two largest nuclear arsenals.

items.title: AI Impact Summit in New Delhi: Governments Move from Discussion to Regulation Action

content.abstract: The AI Impact Summit in New Delhi marks a shift from discussion to concrete action on AI governance, as governments, companies, scientists and activists converge on establishing binding rules for monitoring and regulating powerful AI systems.

items.title: CRISPR Epigenetic Editing: Gene Activation Without DNA Cutting Achieved

content.abstract: Researchers achieve CRISPR breakthrough enabling gene activation by removing chemical epigenetic tags without cutting DNA, opening a safer and more reversible approach to gene therapy that avoids permanent genetic modifications.

items.title: Global Jobs Gap Reaches 408 Million as AI Reshapes Labor Markets

content.abstract: ILO's 2026 World Employment and Social Outlook reports global unemployment at 4.9% while the broader jobs gap reaches 408 million. Women are 24.2% less likely than men to participate in labor force. 51.6% of employers report AI creating new roles.

items.title: Three-Year Global Temperature Average Exceeds 1.5C for First Time

content.abstract: The three-year average global temperature has exceeded 1.5C for the first time, pushing the world to the brink of the Paris Agreement threshold. 2025 was confirmed as one of three warmest years on record.

items.title: US GENIUS Act and CLARITY Act Create First Federal Stablecoin and Digital Asset Framework

content.abstract: The GENIUS Act creates the first federal regulatory framework for stablecoins with backing requirements, while CLARITY Act transfers crypto jurisdiction from SEC to CFTC. Digital asset regulation shifts from enforcement-heavy to market-enabling.

items.title: Boston Dynamics Production Atlas Humanoid Robot Enters Manufacturing at Hyundai Metaplant

content.abstract: Boston Dynamics deploys production-ready electric Atlas humanoid at Hyundai's Metaplant in Georgia. Global industrial robot market hits record $16.7B. BMW pilots Figure AI for intrafactory logistics. Humanoid deployment accelerates but remains primarily pilot-stage.

items.title: China Adds 240 GW Solar in Single Year as Renewables Surpass Coal in Global Electricity

content.abstract: China added an extraordinary 240 GW of new solar capacity, the largest single-country addition ever. Renewables projected to surpass coal as world's largest electricity source by 2025-2026, meeting 90%+ of demand growth.

items.title: WHO Six-Year Post-COVID Assessment: Preparedness Progress Fragile and Uneven

content.abstract: WHO's 6-year post-COVID assessment finds pandemic preparedness improved but fragile. New agreements secure 900+ million vaccine doses. AI-powered platform for early threat detection launched in Berlin. Funding shifting from health to defense puts progress at risk.

items.title: Ethical AI Shifts from Principles to Practice: Accountability Frameworks Demanded

content.abstract: Organizations in 2026 embed ethics and governance into every AI decision, treating transparency, accountability, and fairness as core business priorities. The shift moves from compliance to real accountability, with universities emerging as key responsible AI actors.

items.title: Semiconductor Tariffs Shift to Country of Design: Global Value Chain Fragmentation Accelerates

content.abstract: Semiconductor tariffs now applied based on Country of Design rather than Country of Origin, fundamentally changing how chips are taxed and traded. Critical mineral export controls tighten (cobalt in DRC, rare-earths in China), accelerating supply chain fragmentation.

items.title: Workforce Pell Grants Arrive in 2026: Non-Degree Credentials Gain Federal Funding Parity

content.abstract: Workforce Pell grants launch in 2026, providing federal funding to short-term certificate programs for the first time. States opting into tax-credit scholarship programs for 2027 launch. Movement against children's technology use gains traction.

items.title: US EPA Announces Plans to Rescind Endangerment Finding Supporting Federal Climate Regulations

content.abstract: US EPA announces plans to rescind the endangerment finding that underpins many federal climate regulations, while New York pushes $1B Sustainable Future Fund. ISSB sustainability reporting becomes mandatory in Chile, Nigeria, Brazil, Mexico.

items.title: Cleveland Clinic CRISPR Trial: Single Infusion Safely Reduces Cholesterol and Triglycerides

content.abstract: Phase 1 trial of 15 patients shows one-time CRISPR-Cas9 infusion substantially reduces LDL cholesterol and triglycerides within two weeks, sustained for 60+ days. Targets lipid disorders resistant to current medications.

items.title: US Demographic Slowdown: Next 30 Years to Add Only 23 Million vs Previous 70 Million

content.abstract: US added 70 million people from 1995-2024 but projected to add only 23 million in next 30 years due to plunging birth rates and lower immigration. High- and upper-middle-income economies face aging population and slower labor force growth.
